document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Pace, R.
bibRefCitation.refString: Pace, R. (2001 b) Nuove Aleocharinae del Peru e dell'Ecuador (Coleoptera Staphylinidae), (160 º Contributo alla conoscenza delle Aleocharinae). Bollettino del Museo regionale di Scienze naturali di Torino, 18 (2), 417 - 432.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.
14 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Key: Pace 1990a: 162 (species of the Neotropical region).
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Argentina .

bibRefCitation.author: Ganglbauer, L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ganglbauer, L. (1895) Die Kafer von Mitteleuropa. Die Kafer der osterreichisch-ungarischen Monarchie, Deutschlands, der Schweiz, sowie des franzosischen und italienischen Alpengebietes. Vol. 2, Familienreihe Staphylinoidea, I. Theil: Staphylinidae, Pselaphidae. Carl Gerold's Sohn, Vienna. vi + 881 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 4 species are included in this genus from South America.
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Brazil , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pseudoscopaeus Weise in
Reitter, 1877: 8
[synonymized by Bernhauer & Scheerpeltz 1 926: 573]

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are included in this genus from Central America.
Key: Delgado & Santiago-Jiménez 2009: 66 (species of the New World).
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental .

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from Central America.
Characters/Description: Fenyes 1920: 130 (characters); Ahn & Ashe 1995: 143 (characters), 151 (characters in key); Ashe 2002b: 129 (characters in key).
Key: Ahn & Ashe 1995: 145 (species of the genus).

subSubSection.paragraph: 5 species are known from and are restricted to South America.

South America: Brazil , Chile , Argentina . 0431.
Falagria Leach in Samouelle, 1819: 177
20 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Lynch-Arribálzaga 1884: 29 (characters); Fenyes 1920: 152 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 126 (characters in key).
Key: Fenyes 1920: 136 (subgenera); Pace 2008a: 275 (species of Ecuador and Peru ).
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from South America.

subSubSection.paragraph: 7 species are included in this genus from Latin America.

subSubSection.paragraph: 3 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.

Type species:
Myrmecocephalus cingulatus W.J. MacLeay, 1871
12 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
West Indies: St. Vincent & Grenadines , Grenada .
South America: French Guiana , Ecuador , Galapagos Isl., Bolivia , Brazil , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
